**Analysis:**

I just bought Abstract Joker for $4, leaving me with $10. Now I need to decide what to do next.

My joker setup is now maxed at 5 jokers:
- Zany Joker: +12 Mult if hand contains Three of a Kind
- Sock and Buskin: Retriggers face cards
- Wrathful Joker: +3 Mult per spade card scored
- Business Card: Money from face cards
- Abstract Joker: +15 Mult (constant)


- 
Now I'm working through the scoring potential. With Four of a Kind using 4 spade face cards, I get 120 base chips plus 13 mult. The face cards themselves add 40 chips. Zany Joker triggers since Four of a Kind contains Three of a Kind, giving +12 mult, while Abstract Joker adds +15 mult. The Wrathful Joker multiplies with each spade face card, and Sock and Buskin doubles the triggers on those cards.

For Three of a Kind with 3 spade face cards, the base is 30 chips and 3 mult, with the cards contributing 30 additional chips. The same Jokers apply here—Zany gives +12 mult and Abstract gives +15 mult—while Wrathful Joker provides 18 mult total from the three cards and their doubled triggers. Comparing the final scores, Four of a Kind yields significantly more chips than Three of a Kind.

Both hands clear the Big Blind and Boss Blind thresholds without difficulty. With $10 remaining, I'm weighing whether to invest in Death Tarot to help assemble Four of a Kind more reliably, grab Jumbo Standard Pack for additional deck cards, take Crystal Ball for an extra consumable slot, or reroll the shop. Since I'm already performing well against the upcoming blinds, I should prioritize flexibility—Crystal Ball's consumable slot could prove valuable later, though Death Tarot might accelerate my Four of a Kind strategy. - Final mult: 40 + 24 = 64 mult
- Total: 160 × 64 = 10,240 chips

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
